answers.answer: No, there is no way a person with diabetes will give a false negative after 3 months.
But how can it be justified? Suppose his immune system is weak and thereby reducing the chance of producing enough antibodies?

There is three ways an HIV test can be skewed.1. A person taking chemo2. A person taking antirejection drugs for transplants3. A person that is a chronic IV drug abuser.There is no other medications that will skew an HIV test.If you want further information on testing contact your nearest HIV/STD clinic.
That is also possible. I also read in internet that coinfection of HIV and hepatitis C delay in showing test results.

question: Is there anyway a patient with diabetes will give false negative for an HIV testing (after 3 months of possible exposure)? Suppose his immunity is compromised due to diabetes and his body didnt produce enough antibodies?
title: Diabetes & test results
